message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing tasks such as machine translation. The use of Brown clusters and class-based language difference models also suggests a focus on language modeling and text classification, which are common topics in cs.CL. 

The paper may also be relevant to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it involves the selection of relevant training data for machine translation, which is a machine learning task. 

The use of the cynical data selection method and the focus on efficiency in modeling the task corpus suggests a potential fit with the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper's focus on language modeling and text classification may also make it relevant to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deals with the organization and retrieval of textual information. 

Finally, the use of machine translation as a specific application may suggest a connection to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which deals with the use of neural networks and evolutionary algorithms in machine learning tasks.
